intro: Aspalathus suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet pea bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink and are often clustered in terminal inflorescences. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and it has trifoliate leaves with three oval-shaped leaflets. Aspalathus suaveolens is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive appearance.
